sentences: Lapsed said uued riided ja nad olid rõõmsad riidesse saamise pärast.
Meie pere käis suvel tihti mererannas riidesse minemas.
context: The word 'riidesse' is the illative case form of the Estonian word 'riided', which means 'clothes'. In this context, it indicates movement into or putting on clothes. It's commonly used when describing someone getting dressed or putting on clothing items.
